text: Andaç (historically Alamon) is a village in the district of Uludere in Şırnak Province, in southeastern Turkey.https://www.yerelnet.org.tr/koyler/koy.php?koyid=266339 The village is around away from the district of Uludere and it is located in southeastern Turkey, just on the western border of the Hakkari province. The village was historically populated by Assyrians and populated by Kurds from the Jirki tribe today. == History == The village was destroyed by the Ottoman Army in June 1915, and later rebuilt and populated by Kurds. ==See also== *Arosh *Jilu *Baz *Ashita *Sahdona ==References== Category:Assyrian communities in Turkey Category:Villages in Şırnak Province Category:Kurdish settlements in Turkey
title: Andaç, Uludere
